item.title: Camp Crame to implement 'no face shield, no entry' policy in PNP NHQ starting Aug. 17
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Saturday said police personnel, civilian employees and visitors entering its National Headquarters in Camp Crame, Quezon City will be required to wear face shields starting Monday, August 17.

item.title: COVID Shield seeks TODA leaders' help in quarantine rules enforcement
item.description: The Joint Task Force COVID Shield has sought assistance from transport leaders for the strict implementation of quarantine rules in their areas of responsibility, following reports that some tricycle drivers are still not wearing face masks, and not ensuring passengers' physical distancing.

item.title: Resource persons reveal fraudulent schemes in PhilHealth at DOJ hearing
item.description: Two resource persons formerly connected with the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation have revealed fraudulent schemes by officers and employees of the agency in the first investigative hearing of the Task Force PhilHealth, the Department of Justice said on Saturday.

item.title: Palace dodges recommendation for NEDA s Karl Chua to lead PhilHealth
item.description: Malacañang on Saturday maintained that the power to appoint officials in non-elective positions is the sole prerogative of the President.

item.title: Palace: Gov't has enough allocation for printing of learning modules
item.description: The government has enough budget to fund the printing of learning modules to be used by students for School Year 2020-2021, Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said Saturday.

item.title: CHR expresses grave concern over 'fabricated' drug op killing 6 people
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights on Saturday expressed "grave concern" over a "fabricated" anti-narcotics operations by the San Jose Del Monte Police in Bulacan, and lambasted the trite "nanlaban" rhetoric by operatives to justify incidents involving deaths of suspects in their hands.

item.title: Duterte not backing out of Russian COVID-19 vaccination --Roque
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte is not backing out from his earlier announcement that he is willing to have himself injected with Russia s COVID-19 vaccine in public, his spokesperson Harry Roque said Saturday.

item.title: Palace welcomes SC's final decision allowing Mary Jane Veloso to testify vs. alleged recruiters
item.description: Malacañang was pleased after the Supreme Court stood by its decision to allow Filipina death row inmate Mary Jane Veloso to testify against her alleged recruiters while she is imprisoned in Indonesia.

item.title: Most of PhilHealth execs already signed bank secrecy waiver --spokesperson
item.description: Several top officials of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. have already signed a waiver to allow the Anti-Money Laundering Council to check their bank accounts.

item.title: Most-wanted person sa Iloilo City patay nang manlaban sa mga pulis
item.description: Patay ang isa sa top 5 most-wanted person sa lalawigan ng Iloilo nang manlaban umano ito sa mga awtoridad.

item.title: African Swine Fever reported in Kidapawan City village --DA12
item.description: KIDAPAWAN CITY --The African swine fever virus has already penetrated one of the 40 villages in the city, top agriculture official confirmed on Saturday morning.

item.title: Cebu City, 8 other areas to be under GCQ on Aug. 16; NCR quarantine to be announced Monday
item.description: Malacañang on Saturday announced the quarantine classifications that will be implemented all over the country in the next two weeks.

item.title: PhilHealth clarifies IRM is not only for COVID-19 patients, but for overall pandemic response
item.description: Amid claims that some healthcare institutions were prioritized in the implementation of the interim reimbursement mechanism, the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation on Saturday set the record straight that the cash advance system not only covers COVID-19 patients benefit claims but also for HCIs overall response to the pandemic.

item.title: P13.6M worth of suspected shabu seized from 4 suspects in Lanao del Sur
item.description: Around two kilos of suspected shabu amounting to P13.6 million were seized from four suspects in a joint anti-narcotics operation in Malabang, Lanao Del Sur on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Abu Sayyaf leader Susukan brought to Camp Crame for processing
item.description: Abu Sayyaf Group leader Abduljihad Susukan was brought to Camp Crame in Quezon City early Saturday morning.
